New Records: Nikola Jokic posted his fourth straight triple-double, moving him within three triple-doubles of tying Magic Johnson, and will move into third place on the all-time triple-doubles list if he passes Johnson.
Key Match Events: The Nuggets beat the Dallas Mavericks 122-120, with Nikola Jokic posting 37 points, 18 rebounds, and 15 assists.
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Malone joked that Nikola Jokic's performance would likely move him to 5th in the MVP voting.
Post-Match Reflections: Michael Malone expressed awe at Nikola Jokic's talent, saying 'he's the best player in the world.'
Michael Porter Jr. noted Jokic's consistency and dedication to his body, saying 'he's one of the last ones to leave every night regardless of if we win or lose.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nikola Jokic's teammates are in awe of his performances, with Michael Porter Jr. saying 'there's games where he's getting triple-doubles, but it's not even like close triple-doubles.'
Others: NBA.com had Nikola Jokic ranked third in the MVP race before his monster performance, behind Jayson Tatum and Anthony Davis.
